title: What's News --  World-Wide
text:
Pfizer says it has identified in Mexico and Poland the first confirmed instances of counterfeit versions of the Covid-19 vaccine it developed with BioNTech, the latest move by criminals trying to exploit the world-wide vaccination campaign.

A contract manufacturing plant meant to help make J&J's Covid-19 shot failed to take proper steps to prevent contamination, the FDA said.

---

The Justice Department will investigate whether the Minneapolis Police Department engages in patterns of unconstitutional policing, Garland said, a day after Chauvin's conviction.

---

The Biden administration signaled it is open to easing sanctions against critical elements of Iran's economy, helping to narrow differences in nuclear talks.

---

Biden is expected this week to call for cutting U.S. greenhouse-gas emissions roughly in half by 2030, as he pushes to jump-start global efforts to tackle climate change.

The Biden administration is moving to end a legal battle with California over the state's authority to regulate motor-vehicle emissions.

---

Putin said Moscow would deliver a swift, harsh response to any foreign threat, as Russia builds up its military presence at the border with Ukraine.

---

Biden is poised to formally declare that the massacres of Armenians in the early 20th century constituted genocide, a step that would further inflame ties with Turkey.
